If students wear snow boots, they need to bring a pair of shoes to change into. Students can wear dress code sweaters or Hawthorn jackets in the classroom, but all other outerwear must be removed when students return inside.

You can view a dress code quick-reference guide here on our website: https://www.hawthornacademy.org/dynamic/content/1095/53/quick_reference_dress_code_n83cf.pdf

post_text: Our 8th graders are putting their statistics skills to use as they investigate the relationship between student grade level and student height, and record their data on a hallway-long scatterplot. After reviewing their data, they will reflect on their process and make a prediction for what similar data would look like if they measured adults. We are so proud of our math department and the rigorous work our students do there!

Our Hawthorn family has been saddened this week by the loss of one our own. Kimberly Tolman, a fifth grade teacher at our South Jordan campus, passed away on Monday morning.

Kim was a thoughtful and dedicated teacher who loved her students. She was a dear friend to many of her coworkers, and a pleasure to work with. She will be greatly missed at Hawthorn Academy.

Kim's funeral services will be held on Saturday, August 19th at 11:00 a.m. at the LDS Eaglecrest 4th Ward meetinghouse on 700 W 2600 N in Lehi. The viewing will begin at 9:00 a.m. She will be buried at Eastlawn Memorial Hills in Provo. You can view her obituary at http://www.legacy.com/obituaries/deseretnews/obituary.aspx?page=lifestory&pid=186399623

It has been said that every end is a new beginning. We have been fortunate to work with Marie Steffensen since we first opened our doors, and anyone who’s worked with her knows what a passionate and caring educator she is. Marie has been offered an exciting opportunity to work as the executive director of a new charter school, and will be leaving Hawthorn Academy on January 13. We will miss her but know that she will be an asset to her new school community.

Some of you may know Candalyn Winder, who has been working with us as an administrative intern this year. As she has completed her internship, we are thrilled to be able to offer her a position on our administrative team IB Coordinator and trust we will not skip a beat as she transitions into this new role. Candalyn brings with her years of IB experience and is already a valuable part of our Hawthorn Academy team.

We look forward to continued growth and success for all of our students, families, and educators as we strive to provide the best educational experience possible at Hawthorn Academy.
